body: Trained under great masters who preached the simple truth that two are better than one when it comes to weapons, the two-weapon warrior is a terror when his hands are full. From paired daggers to exotic double weapons, all combinations come equally alive in his skilled hands.
name: Two-Weapon Warrior
url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior

sections.body: At 3rd level, when a two-weapon warrior makes a full attack with both weapons, he gains a +1 dodge bonus to AC against melee attacks until the beginning of his next turn. This bonus increases by +1 every four levels after 3rd. This ability replaces armor training 1 and 2.
sections.name: Defensive Flurry
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Defensive Flurry

sections.body: At 5th level, a two-weapon warrior gains a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls when making a full attack with two weapons or a double weapon. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels after 5th. This ability replaces weapon training 1.
sections.name: Twin Blades
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Twin Blades

sections.body: At 9th level, a two-weapon warrior may, as a standard action, make one attack with both his primary and secondary weapons. The penalties for attacking with two weapons apply normally. This ability replaces weapon training 2.
sections.name: Doublestrike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Doublestrike

sections.body: At 11th level, the attack penalties for fighting with two weapons are reduced by –1 for a two-weapon warrior. Alternatively, he may use a one-handed weapon in his off-hand, treating it as if it were a light weapon with the normal light weapon penalties. This ability replaces armor training 3.
sections.name: Improved Balance
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Improved Balance

sections.body: At 13th level, when a two-weapon warrior makes an attack of opportunity, he may attack once with both his primary and secondary weapons. The penalties for attacking with two weapons apply normally. This ability replaces weapon training 3.
sections.name: Equal Opportunity
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Equal Opportunity

sections.body: At 15th level, the penalties for fighting with two weapons are reduced by an additional –1 for a two-weapon warrior. This benefit stacks with improved balance. If he is using a one-handed weapon in his off hand, treating it as a light weapon, he uses the normal light weapon penalties. This ability replaces armor training 4.
sections.name: Perfect Balance
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Perfect Balance

sections.body: At 17th level, when a two-weapon warrior hits an opponent with both weapons, he can make a disarm or sunder attempt (or trip, if one or both weapons can be used to trip) against that opponent as an immediate action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity. This ability replaces weapon training 4.
sections.name: Deft Doublestrike
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Deft Doublestrike

sections.body: At 19th level, when a two-weapon warrior makes a full attack with both weapons, every creature that hits him with a melee attack before the beginning of his next turn provokes an attack of opportunity from the warrior. This ability replaces armor mastery.
sections.name: Deadly Defense
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Fighter/Fighter Archetypes/Two-Weapon Warrior/Deadly Defense
